definition: to spread/to display/to set up/(old) holder for door-knocker
plank bed/place to sleep/shop/store/(old) relay station
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
store/front room of house serving as shop

sentences.english: The circular courtyard, in front of the ancestral hall, is also paved with granite plate.
sentences.chinese: 回望祖堂前的圆形天井，也同样是以花岗石板铺面。

sentences.english: The details of the facade will be further fitted up to match the interior.
sentences.chinese: 铺面将进一步加以装修使之与室内装饰协调一致。

sentences.english: The flower downstairs upstairs is interspersed, the shop front is meticulous and graceful.
sentences.chinese: 楼上楼下鲜花点缀，铺面精细而高雅。

sentences.english: In at least one case, there was a long and wide crack on a metalled road.
sentences.chinese: 至少有一条碎石铺面的道路出现又长又宽的裂缝。

sentences.english: Feng Poly Street to get the day retreat to the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 冯广聚把到手的天街铺面给退了。

definition: the store front/the part of a house facing the street serving as a store
store/front room of house serving as shop
